content:
Imagine you are a robot browsing the web, just like humans. Now you need to complete a task. In each iteration, you will receive an Observation that includes a screenshot of a webpage and some texts. This screenshot will feature Numerical Labels placed in the TOP LEFT corner of each Web Element.
Carefully analyze the visual information to identify the Numerical Label corresponding to the Web Element that requires interaction, then follow the guidelines and choose one of the following actions:
1. Click a Web Element.
2. Delete existing content in a textbox and then type content. 
3. Scroll up or down. Multiple scrolls are allowed to browse the webpage. Pay attention!! The default scroll is the whole window. If the scroll widget is located in a certain area of the webpage, then you have to specify a Web Element in that area. I would hover the mouse there and then scroll.
4. Wait. Typically used to wait for unfinished webpage processes, with a duration of 5 seconds.
5. Go back, returning to the previous webpage.
6. Google, directly jump to the Google search page. When you can't find information in some websites, try starting over with Google.
7. Answer. This action should only be chosen when all questions in the task have been solved.

Correspondingly, Action should STRICTLY follow the format:
- Click [Numerical_Label]
- Type [Numerical_Label]; [Content]
- Scroll [Numerical_Label or WINDOW]; [up or down]
- Wait
- GoBack
- Google
- ANSWER; [content]

Key Guidelines You MUST follow:
* Action guidelines *
1) To input text, NO need to click textbox first, directly type content. After typing, the system automatically hits `ENTER` key. Sometimes you should click the search button to apply search filters. Try to use simple language when searching.  
2) You must Distinguish between textbox and search button, don't type content into the button! If no textbox is found, you may need to click the search button first before the textbox is displayed. 
3) Execute only one action per iteration. 
4) STRICTLY Avoid repeating the same action if the webpage remains unchanged. You may have selected the wrong web element or numerical label. Continuous use of the Wait is also NOT allowed.
5) When a complex Task involves multiple questions or steps, select "ANSWER" only at the very end, after addressing all of these questions (steps). Flexibly combine your own abilities with the information in the web page. Double check the formatting requirements in the task when ANSWER. 
* Web Browsing Guidelines *
1) Don't interact with useless web elements like Login, Sign-in, donation that appear in Webpages. Pay attention to Key Web Elements like search textbox and menu.
2) Vsit video websites like YouTube is allowed BUT you can't play videos. Clicking to download PDF is allowed and will be analyzed by the Assistant API.
3) Focus on the numerical labels in the TOP LEFT corner of each rectangle (element). Ensure you don't mix them up with other numbers (e.g. Calendar) on the page.
4) Focus on the date in task, you must look for results that match the date. It may be necessary to find the correct year, month and day at calendar.
5) Pay attention to the filter and sort functions on the page, which, combined with scroll, can help you solve conditions like 'highest', 'cheapest', 'lowest', 'earliest', etc. Try your best to find the answer that best fits the task.

Your reply should strictly follow the format:
Thought: {Your brief thoughts (briefly summarize the info that will help ANSWER)}
Action: {One Action format you choose}
Confidence: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating your confidence level in the action. A higher value means greater confidence.}
Completion: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating how much of the task has been completed until now. Zero means no progress has been made and one means full completion.}

Then the User will provide:
Observation: {A labeled screenshot Given by User}

Now given a task: Locate a hotel in Melbourne offering free parking and free WiFi, for a stay from February 28 to March 4, 2026.  Please interact with https://www.booking.com/ and get the answer.Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: To begin searching for hotels in Melbourne, I need to specify the destination. The textbox labeled "Where are you going?" is the appropriate place to enter "Melbourne".
Action: Type [14]; Melbourne
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.1
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The calendar is currently on September and October 2025, but the required check-in date is February 28, 2026. I need to navigate forward through the months to reach February 2026.
Action: Click [18]
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.15
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I need to move further ahead on the calendar to reach February 2026. The button labeled "Next month" will allow me to keep advancing month by month.
Action: Click [19]
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.18
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I am now at December 2025, but I still need to reach February 2026 for the correct check-in date. I should continue clicking "Next month".
Action: Click [19]
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.2
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The calendar now displays January 2026, but I need to select dates from February 28 to March 4, 2026. I must keep clicking "Next month" until February 2026 is visible.
Action: Click [19]
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.25
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: February 2026 is now visible on the calendar. I need to select February 28, 2026 as the check-in date and then select March 4, 2026 as the check-out date, which will likely be visible after clicking February 28.
Action: Click [82]
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.3
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I have already selected February 28, 2026 as the check-in date. Now I need to select March 4, 2026 as the check-out date. I must click "Next month" to display March 2026.
Action: Click [19]
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.35
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: March 2026 is now visible. I should select March 4, 2026 (element [51]) as the check-out date to complete the date range: February 28 – March 4, 2026.
Action: Click [51]
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.4
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The correct check-in and check-out dates (Feb 28 to Mar 4, 2026) are selected. To proceed, I need to search for hotels in Melbourne for these dates.
Action: Click [93]
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.5

Currently selected: 2 adults · 0 children · 1 room";	[17]: <button> "Search";	[18]: "Home";	[19]: "Australia";	[20]: "Victoria";	[21]: "Melbourne";	[22]: "Search results";	[23]: <button> "Show on map";	[24]: "List";	[25]: "Grid";	[26]: <button> "Sort by: Our top picks";	[28]: <button> "Save this item to a trip list";	[29]: "Melbourne Corporate Stays - Docklands WaterfrontOpens in new window";	[30]: "Docklands, Melbourne (Collins Street)Show on map";	[31]: "Scored 8.8 8.8Excellent 12 reviews";	[32]: "Entire apartment • 1 bedroom • 1 living room • 1 bathroom • 1 kitchen • 70 m²2 beds (1 king, 1 sofa bed) • Crib always available";	[33]: "Only 2 left at this price on our site";	[34]: "See availability";

content:
Thought: The search results for Melbourne hotels on the selected dates are shown. To refine the results for hotels with both free parking and free WiFi, I need to apply the respective filters. The available filters on the left include "Free Wifi" [101] and "Free parking" [100].
Action: Click [100]
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.6
The action you have chosen cannot be exected. Please double-check if you have selected the wrong Numerical Label or Action or Action format. Then provide the revised Thought and Action.

Thought: I attempted to click on "Free parking" but selected an incorrect element for interaction. I should instead click the "Free Wifi" filter, which is clearly labeled [101] and visible in the filter list, to start narrowing down hotels.
Action: Click [101]
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.6
The action you have chosen cannot be exected. Please double-check if you have selected the wrong Numerical Label or Action or Action format. Then provide the revised Thought and Action.

Thought: The clickable filter checkboxes are likely next to the text labels under "Popular filters." Since "Free parking" is the first popular filter listed at [100], I should click "Free parking" first (rather than the text). I will try with [100].
Action: Click [100]
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.6
The action you have chosen cannot be exected. Please double-check if you have selected the wrong Numerical Label or Action or Action format. Then provide the revised Thought and Action.

Thought: It appears that the numerical labels for the actual interactive filter checkboxes (for "Free Wifi" and "Free parking") are not being recognized as clickable. Instead, perhaps a scroll is needed to reveal a different interface or more options for filter interactivity, or to see if filter checkboxes load after scrolling.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 0.8
Completion: 0.62
